Definition: Given a statement and sentences 1, 2, 3. Your task is to determine the sentence which entails with the given statement and output the number accordingly.

Positive Examples.input: Statement: Party entrepreneurs were often newspaper editors and postmasters, and postmasterships quickly became a staple of party patronage. Choices: 1.  Newspaper editors and postmasters are a staple of the party.  2. Beauty gurus are the party's main patronage. 3. The editors use terrible tactics to gain funds.
Positive Examples.explanation: Only choice 1 entails with the statement as the information given in the other 2 choices cannot be interpreted from the statement.

The candy has many fans who love its attractions. 2. There's four stories of memorabilia dedicated to a candy. 3. That particular candy melts and becomes difficult to eat.

Positive Examples.input: Statement: okay we'll i'll talk to you bye-bye Choices: 1. This is the last time I am talking to you. 2. I will call you in the morning. 3. I will talk to you again, goodbye.
Positive Examples.explanation: The statement indicates that I will talk to you at a later point of time while choice 1 says that it is the last time that I am talking to you and choice 2 says that I will call in the morning but the actual time when I am going to talk is not implied in the statement and only sentence 2 entails the statement.
